title: Large-Scale Project-Based Knowledge Integration and Language Learning Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic project management knowledge and intermediate or higher language proficiency
context.additional_context: Knowledge integration learning through collaboration and language use among team members in a virtual project environment

learning_goals: Learners collaborate with 3–5 team members in a 4-week project-based simulation environment to establish two shared goals and present a one-page report including three actionable plans for strengthening cognitive-social capital.
Learners apply at least three language strategies to build trust relationships (relational social capital) in VR-based collaborative tools

Over three weeks, learners integrate three types of team knowledge (e.g., jargon, cultural context, communication strategies) into project deliverables, (1) develop two new language expressions (exploratory learning) for team sharing, and (2) achieve applied learning outcomes by applying three existing language systems (e.g., grammar rules, vocabulary expansion, pronunciation principles) meeting ≥4 of 5 rubric criteria (creativity, accuracy, practicality, collaboration, completeness).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
